intro: Alsinidendron lychnoides, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Alsinidendron lychnoides is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
